intro: Oriastrum stuebelii, commonly known as the Stuebel's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its globular shape, with dense clusters of yellow flowers surrounded by velvety, green bracts. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Oriastrum stuebelii is often found in rocky habitats and is considered a valuable plant for xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
